feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued June 28 at 2:23PM AKDT until June 29 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 10 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Gustavus, Elfin Cove, Klawock, Craig, Ketchikan, and Metlakatla. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 10 AM AKDT Wednesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Glacier Bay; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:59PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIVER LEVELS THROUGH MID-WEEK... With record heat, significant snowmelt in higher terrain has caused high river levels and near bankfull conditions in rivers and streams throughout Upper Lynn Canal. This includes the Chilkat, the Klehini, and Taiya Rivers. No flooding is expected, although high water is anticipated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Dense Smoke Advisory issued June 28 at 10:11AM AKDT until June 29 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE SMOKE ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense smoke. * WHERE...Central Interior. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and poor air quality.

entry.title: Dense Smoke Advisory issued June 28 at 10:11AM AKDT until June 29 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:16PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Butler and northern Crenshaw Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 616 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Highland Home, or 13 miles north of Luverne, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central DeKalb County through 700 PM CDT... At 610 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Little River Falls to near Fort Payne. Movement was slowly north at 5 mph. Heavy rainfall may cause nuisance flooding in and around Fort Payne shortly.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington and south central Clarke Counties through 645 PM CDT... entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Mobile Inland; Washington

entry.summary: ...Hot and dry conditions combined with winds gusting over 30 mph are expected across portions of northeast Colorado. .Temperature near and exceeding 100 degrees will combine with winds 15-25 mph gusting to 30 mph during the afternoon hours. Relative Humidity is expected to drop to near 10 percent as well. Fuels are drying out with every passing day, and are probably not
